page.title: 19Hempriggs Loch
page.content: This is a shallow freshwater loch of area 1sq.km.It is the only one of five similar lochs that lies within the block.To the N. the site consists of old flooded peat cuttings and a float- ing net of sedges and mosses which reach into the loch.The dry ridges are dominated by heathers and a colony of black-headed gulls breeds in the swamp edge.To the S. there is an area of marsh but grazing animals disturb the vegetation.Further S. the wetter areas are rich in plant species.The stony bottom provides a good habitat for flatworms and insect larvae and these together with the vegetation support a large trout population and wintering birds such as Widgeon,Mallards and Swans.The loch is fished from the shore and from boats.At one time the water was used to make whisky by Pulteneytown Distillery in Wick.
